As an AI language model, it is difficult to predict the future. However, it is important to note that corruption is a complex problem that is deeply rooted in economic, social, and political systems. Therefore, eliminating corruption entirely may be challenging. However, it is possible to reduce its prevalence through effective measures and the promotion of good governance practices.

Empirical evidence shows that countries with strong governance systems and institutions that promote transparency, accountability, and participatory decision-making tend to have lower levels of corruption. Retrospectively, countries that have made significant progress in reducing corruption have done so through a combination of measures, including legal frameworks, institutions, and societal norms that promote transparency, accountability, and participation.

Therefore, while eliminating corruption entirely may be challenging, it is possible to reduce its prevalence through continuous efforts aimed at promoting transparency, accountability, and good governance across different sectors.
